Question: This incident occurred during a cabinet meeting when this person suddenly found himself unable to speak or move his right hand.
Hints: This person told Kennedy he considered Laos to be "the cork in the bottle" with regard to the regional threat.
After his retirement, this person referred to his appointments of Warren and Brennan as his "great mistakes as President.".
In December 1943, President Roosevelt decided that this person—not Marshall—would be Supreme Allied Commander in Europe.
